Sentencas: Yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) is one of the most common solid electrolyte materials for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Low-temperature sintering and microstructure evolution of Bi2O3-doped YSZ

Sentencas: However, the sintering temperature of commercial YSZ powders is usually above 1500 degrees C.
Titulo: Low-temperature sintering and microstructure evolution of Bi2O3-doped YSZ

Sentencas: In this work, powders with variable amounts (from 1 mol% to 12 mol%) of bismuth oxide (Bi2O3) were separately added to commercially available yttria partially stabilized zirconia (3YSZ) powders as sintering additives, in order to lower the sintering temperature of the latter.
Titulo: Low-temperature sintering and microstructure evolution of Bi2O3-doped YSZ

Sentencas: After the addition, the powder mixtures were dry-pressed and sintered at different temperatures between 850 degrees C and 1200 degrees C.
Titulo: Low-temperature sintering and microstructure evolution of Bi2O3-doped YSZ

Sentencas: Then, the relative densities, phases and microstructures of the sintered ceramic specimens were analyzed.
Titulo: Low-temperature sintering and microstructure evolution of Bi2O3-doped YSZ

Sentencas: The results indicated that the addition of Bi2O3 enhanced the sintering activity of 3YSZ, resulting in a 3YSZ material with an extremely low sintering temperature.
Titulo: Low-temperature sintering and microstructure evolution of Bi2O3-doped YSZ

Sentencas: When the amount of Bi2O3 exceeded 7 mol%, the ceramic specimens were densified up to 96.3% by a pressureless conventional sintering process at 850 degrees C for only 1.5 h. Furthermore, Bi2O3 can affect the degree of crystallinity of different phases, such as the tetragonal phase and monoclinic phase in 3YSZ powder.
Titulo: Low-temperature sintering and microstructure evolution of Bi2O3-doped YSZ
